content: the fabric density you prefer notions o us j 6 mm for dk+fingering worsted or aran o us l 8 mm for bulky § removable stitch markers optional for marking between single_crochet and half_double_crochet repeats and for identifying the rs of your work § yarn needle for weaving in ends notes § pattern has been written using us crochet terminology § cowl is worked sideways and then seamed at the back ribbed cowl § determine desired height for cowl measure from just below jawline beneath ear down the neck and across shoulder to the point where you want the cowl to reach when worn 1 skein of yarn made a cowl approximately 8-9 high for my samples § create a chain that matches the height you ve chosen when slightly stretched choose an even number of stitches and then add one divide the even number by 2 § rs starting in the second chain from the hook scbl in half of the stitches your even number divided by 2 then hdcbl in the last half of the stitches chain 1 turn doesn t count as a stitch note for example my dk+fingering weight cowl was made using a chain of 32+1 each row of ribbing therefore contained 16 scbl and abbreviations 16hdcbl stitches you may find it helpful to use a removable stitch marker to mark where stitches chain chain change from single_crochet to half_double_crochet scbl single_crochet in the back loop § ws hdcbl in each hdcbl from previous row only scbl in each scbl from previous row chain 1 turn hdcbl half_double_crochet in the back § continue in this manner scbl for the top half and loop only hcbl for bottom half until you run out of yarn or rs right side of work the cowl is the circumference you desire wrapping around your neck end with a ws row leaving a tail ws wrong side of work approximately 1½ times as long as your cowl is tall § seam two sides together i used a mattress stitch on the rs weave in your ends and block if desired © 2023 rebecca carlson | rosalie s daughter - 2 -
